author: Bill Kendrick
message: Adorable! (That reminds me, I need to support differently-sized UI buttons to make it easier to use on high-dots-per-pixel displays!)

author: Chris
message: How did you get Tux Paint working on the N810 with OS2008? Is there a known port available? All I can find is for OS2005/2006 for the N770.

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: I installed it a long time ago, so I do not remember where I got it. The installed package is version 0.9.15b on armel architecture, so I guess it is the OS2006 version from http://tuxpaint.org/downloa...

replies.author: Chris
replies.message:
Thanks...I already tried that version, but it doesn't seem to work on a N810 running OS2008. I check with the developer, as well as those more knowledgeable than I at Maemo.org.

I was very excited hearing it works on a N810. Both me and my kids are big fans of Tux Paint.

-- Chris

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message: Good idea, they probably know better than me :)
